pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:0.5: 41. The training rule on royal houses
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.2: a picture had been drawn in the decorated pleasure-house in King Pasenadi of Kosala’s park.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.3: Many people went to see the pleasure-house,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.4: and so did the nuns from the group of six.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.6: “How can nuns go to see the pleasure-house? They are just like householders who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.7: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.8: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.9: “How can the nuns from the group of six go to see a pleasure-house?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.13: “… How can the nuns from the group of six go to see a pleasure-house?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.15: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.16: ‘If a nun goes to see a royal house or a pleasure-house or a park or a garden or a lotus pond, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.15: If she is on her way to see them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.16: Wherever she stands to see them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.17: Every time she moves outside the range of sight and then sees them again, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.18: If she is on her way to see any one of them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.19: Wherever she stands to see it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.20: Every time she moves outside the range of sight and then sees it again, she commits an offense entailing confession.
